parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
To give solemn evidence, testify (declare) solemnly. From dia and martureo; to attest or protest earnestly, or hortatively.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From horion; to mark out or bound, i.e. to appoint, decree, specify.
A primary preposition; under, i.e. of place, or with verbs; of place (underneath) or where (below) or time (when).
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A judge, magistrate, ruler. From krino; a judge.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
